ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I developed a greater awareness of the tactics used to communicate complex scientific information, as well as specifics unique to communicating psychological findings, including seamlessly introduced citations, interviewing techniques, ways to pare down concepts without losing the essence of a study, and science through storytelling.
I learned how to communicate not just psychological science, but science in general, as a result of this class. Also, I learned how to present data in different forms other than essays.
I studied and discussed best practices for communicating psychology research across media (podcasts, articles, social media).
Learnt about best practices to communicate science to a variety of audiences.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I would've liked to have more outside texts about communication (in various contexts of psychological science) to bring into our discussions. However, I appreciated the final project format, freedom, and peer review process! Many minds elucidating a unique idea is usually better than 1 or 2.

Strengths: Every person in the class has a different interest and this really makes the discussions interesting. Professor Santos is really good at building off of everyone's points. Weaknesses: Class length was a bit long.

Strengths are that there were realistic expectations on students regarding workload and engagement in class -- having fewer but more interactive assignments made for a lively class discussion every week. I can't report any weaknesses!

This class was such a gem because of how engaged all students were in discussion. We rarely get to discuss research outside of academia, and so everyone was invested in the conversation and brought such interesting points to the table!
Enjoyed taking a different type of psychology class and the content and assignments were interesting. Structure of lessons could be improved.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I'd definitely recommend this course to someone like me who is interested in the cognitive science of persuasion, to offer them a high level vantage point from which to examine this idea before getting back into the weeds of rigorous scientific study of the mind.

Definitely. If you are someone who wants to be able to talk about your scientific interests to people without the same knowledge, this is the class for you. Also, it's a relatively low workload and the projects are fun.

Absolutely. Dr. Santos is phenomenal and I think there is no better qualified person to teach a class on communicating psych at Yale. She's super helpful, supportive, and kind.  An amazing role model and mentor!
Oh yes! I think this class must be a staple in the major
Yes, I would recommend this course. It's a really important subject matter, and the course is interesting and engaging.
Yes I enjoyed exploring different aspects of psychology and doing different types of assignments.
